verses.roman:
keha--haridāsa, sadā bale 'hari' 'hari'
jāni kāra ghare dhana karibeka curi

synonyms: keha—some of them; haridāsa—of the name Haridāsa; sadā—always; bale—says; hari hari—the name of the Lord, "Hari, Hari"; jāni—I understand; kāra—someone's; ghare—at home; dhana—wealth; karibeka—will do; curi—theft.
translation: " 'Some of them are called Haridāsa. They always chant "Hari, Hari," and thus I thought they would steal the riches from someone's house.

purport.content: Another meaning of "Hari, Hari" is "I am stealing. I am stealing."
